intro: Lepidaploa persericea, commonly known as the silky leaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Lepidaploa persericea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
